acqinfo.p: The records were the gift of Jack Winans (donor no. 10652) and came to the library in October 2011.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Vogel’s & Wurster’s records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Vogel's & Wurster's was a Chelsea, Michigan mercantile establishment. The firm was known as H.S. Holmes Mercantile Company from the 1880s to about 1916. The firm was then reorganized as Vogel's & Wurster's. Dallas H. Wurster and Edward Vogel had previously served as secretary and treasurer of the Holmes firm. Sometime after World War II, the store was renamed Vogel's & Foster's.

scopecontent.p: The Vogel & Wurster business records consists of ledgers, financial journals, and other business records primarily in the period when the firm was known as H.S. Holmes Mercantile Company from the 1880s to about 1916.
